    • Method Detail

      • getCertificateChain

        Collection<Certificate> getCertificateChain​(int caid)
        Retrieves the certificate chain for the signer. The returned certificate chain MUST have the RootCA certificate in the last position.
        Parameters:
        caid - is the issuerdn.hashCode()
        Returns:
        Collection of Certificate, the certificate chain, never null.

      • createPKCS7

        byte[] createPKCS7​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken admin,
                   X509Certificate cert,
                   boolean includeChain)
            throws org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException,
                   org.cesecore.certificates.ca.SignRequestSignatureException,
                   org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException
        Creates a signed PKCS7 message containing the whole certificate chain, including the provided client certificate.
        Parameters:
        admin - Information about the administrator or admin performing the event.
        cert - client certificate which we want encapsulated in a PKCS7 together with certificate chain.
        includeChain - chain
        Returns:
        The DER-encoded PKCS7 message.
        Throws:
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException - if the CA does not exist or is expired, or has an invalid cert
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.SignRequestSignatureException - if the certificate is not signed by the CA
        org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException - fail

      • createPKCS7

        byte[] createPKCS7​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken admin,
                   int caId,
                   boolean includeChain)
            throws org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException,
                   org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException
        Creates a signed PKCS7 message containing the whole certificate chain of the specified CA.
        Parameters:
        admin - Information about the administrator or admin performing the event.
        caId - CA for which we want a PKCS7 certificate chain.
        includeChain - chain
        Returns:
        The DER-encoded PKCS7 message.
        Throws:
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException - if the CA does not exist or is expired, or has an invalid cert
        org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException - fail

      • createPKCS7Rollover

        byte[] createPKCS7Rollover​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken admin,
                           int caId)
                    throws org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException,
                           org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException
        Creates a roll over PKCS7 for the next CA certificate, signed by the current CA key. Used by ScepServlet.
        Parameters:
        admin - admin
        caId - CA
        Returns:
        A DER-encoded PKCS7 message, or null if there's no next CA certificate.
        Throws:
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException - fail
        org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException - fail

      • createCertificate

        Certificate createCertificate​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken admin,
                              String username,
                              String password,
                              org.cesecore.keys.util.PublicKeyWrapper pk,
                              int keyusage,
                              Date notBefore,
                              Date notAfter)
                       throws org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException,
                              org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException,
                              org.ejbca.core.model.ca.AuthStatusException,
                              org.ejbca.core.model.ca.AuthLoginException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.IllegalKeyException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.CertificateCreateException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.ca.IllegalNameException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.CertificateRevokeException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.exception.CertificateSerialNumberException,
                              org.cesecore.keys.token.CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.ca.IllegalValidityException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CAOfflineException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.ca.InvalidAlgorithmException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.exception.CustomCertificateSerialNumberException,
                              org.ejbca.core.ejb.ra.NoSuchEndEntityException
        Requests for a certificate to be created for the passed public key with the passed key usage. The method queries the user database for authorization of the user. CAs are only allowed to have certificateSign and CRLSign set.
        Parameters:
        admin - Information about the administrator or admin performing the event.
        username - unique username within the instance.
        password - password for the user.
        pk - the public key to be put in the created certificate.
        keyusage - integer with bit mask describing desired keys usage, overrides keyUsage from CertificateProfiles if allowed. Bit mask is packed in in integer using constants from CertificateData. -1 means use default keyUsage from CertificateProfile. ex. int keyusage = CertificateData.digitalSignature | CertificateData.nonRepudiation; gives digitalSignature and nonRepudiation. ex. int keyusage = CertificateData.keyCertSign | CertificateData.cRLSign; gives keyCertSign and cRLSign
        notBefore - An optional validity to set in the created certificate, if the profile allows validity override, null if the profile's default validity should be used
        notAfter - An optional validity to set in the created certificate, if the profile allows validity override, null if the profile's default validity should be used
        Returns:
        The newly created certificate or null.
        Throws:
        org.ejbca.core.ejb.ra.NoSuchEndEntityException - if the user does not exist.
        org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException - (rollback) if admin is not authorized to issue this certificate
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException - if the CA defined by caId doesn't exist.
        org.ejbca.core.model.ca.AuthStatusException - If the users status is incorrect.
        org.ejbca.core.model.ca.AuthLoginException - If the password is incorrect.
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.InvalidAlgorithmException - if the signing algorithm in the certificate profile (or the CA Token if not found) was invalid.
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CAOfflineException - if the CA was offline
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.IllegalValidityException - if the validity defined by notBefore and notAfter was invalid
        org.cesecore.keys.token.CryptoTokenOfflineException - if the crypto token for the CA wasn't found
        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.exception.CertificateSerialNumberException - if certificate with same subject DN or key already exists for a user, if these limitations are enabled in CA.
        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.CertificateRevokeException - (rollback) if certificate was meant to be issued revoked, but could not.
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.IllegalNameException - if the certificate request contained an illegal name
        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.CertificateCreateException - (rollback) if certificate couldn't be created.
        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.IllegalKeyException - if the public key didn't conform to the constrains of the CA's certificate profile.
        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.exception.CustomCertificateSerialNumberException - (no rollback) if custom serial number is registered for user, but it is not allowed to be used (either missing unique index in database, or certificate profile does not allow it

      • createCertificate

        Certificate createCertificate​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken admin,
                              String username,
                              String password,
                              org.cesecore.keys.util.PublicKeyWrapper pk)
                       throws org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException,
                              org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.IllegalKeyException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.CertificateCreateException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.ca.IllegalNameException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.CertificateRevokeException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.exception.CertificateSerialNumberException,
                              org.cesecore.keys.token.CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.ca.IllegalValidityException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CAOfflineException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.ca.InvalidAlgorithmException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.exception.CustomCertificateSerialNumberException,
                              org.ejbca.core.model.ca.AuthStatusException,
                              org.ejbca.core.model.ca.AuthLoginException,
                              org.ejbca.core.ejb.ra.NoSuchEndEntityException
        Requests for a certificate to be created for the passed public key with default key usage The method queries the user database for authorization of the user.
        Parameters:
        admin - Information about the administrator or admin performing the event.
        username - unique username within the instance.
        password - password for the user.
        pk - the public key to be put in the created certificate.
        Returns:
        The newly created certificate or null.
        Throws:
        org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException - (rollback) if admin is not authorized to issue this certificate
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException - if the CA defined by caId doesn't exist.
        org.ejbca.core.model.ca.AuthStatusException - If the end entity's status is incorrect.
        org.ejbca.core.model.ca.AuthLoginException - If the password is incorrect.
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.InvalidAlgorithmException - if the signing algorithm in the certificate profile (or the CA Token if not found) was invalid.
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CAOfflineException - if the CA was offline
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.IllegalValidityException - if the validity defined by notBefore and notAfter was invalid
        org.cesecore.keys.token.CryptoTokenOfflineException - if the crypto token for the CA wasn't found
        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.exception.CertificateSerialNumberException - if certificate with same subject DN or key already exists for a user, if these limitations are enabled in CA.
        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.CertificateRevokeException - (rollback) if certificate was meant to be issued revoked, but could not.
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.IllegalNameException - if the certificate request contained an illegal name
        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.CertificateCreateException - (rollback) if certificate couldn't be created.
        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.IllegalKeyException - if the public key didn't conform to the constrains of the CA's certificate profile.
        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.exception.CustomCertificateSerialNumberException - (no rollback) if custom serial number is registered for user, but it is not allowed to be used (either missing unique index in database, or certificate profile does not allow it
        org.ejbca.core.ejb.ra.NoSuchEndEntityException - if the end entity was not found

      • createCertificate

        Certificate createCertificate​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken admin,
                              String username,
                              String password,
                              Certificate incert)
                       throws org.ejbca.core.ejb.ra.NoSuchEndEntityException,
                              org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.ca.SignRequestSignatureException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException,
                              org.ejbca.core.model.ca.AuthStatusException,
                              org.ejbca.core.model.ca.AuthLoginException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.IllegalKeyException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.CertificateCreateException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.ca.IllegalNameException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.CertificateRevokeException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.exception.CertificateSerialNumberException,
                              org.cesecore.keys.token.CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.ca.IllegalValidityException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CAOfflineException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.ca.InvalidAlgorithmException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.exception.CustomCertificateSerialNumberException
        Requests for a certificate to be created for the passed public key wrapped in a self-signed certificate. Verification of the signature (proof-of-possession) on the request is performed, and an exception thrown if verification fails. The method queries the user database for authorization of the user.
        Parameters:
        admin - Information about the administrator or admin performing the event.
        username - unique username within the instance.
        password - password for the user.
        incert - a certificate containing the public key to be put in the created certificate. Other (requested) parameters in the passed certificate can be used, such as DN, Validity, KeyUsage etc. Currently only KeyUsage is considered!
        Returns:
        The newly created certificate or null.
        Throws:
        org.ejbca.core.ejb.ra.NoSuchEndEntityException - if the user does not exist.
        org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException - (rollback) if admin is not authorized to issue this certificate
        org.ejbca.core.model.ca.AuthStatusException - If the users status is incorrect.
        org.ejbca.core.model.ca.AuthLoginException - If the password is incorrect.
        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.IllegalKeyException - if the public key didn't conform to the constrains of the CA's certificate profile.
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.SignRequestSignatureException - if the provided client certificate was not signed
        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.exception.CustomCertificateSerialNumberException - (no rollback) if custom serial number is registered for user, but it is not allowed to be used (either missing unique index in database, or certificate profile does not allow it * @throws InvalidAlgorithmException if the signing algorithm in the certificate profile (or the CA Token if not found) was invalid.
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CAOfflineException - if the CA was offline
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.IllegalValidityException - if the validity defined by notBefore and notAfter was invalid
        org.cesecore.keys.token.CryptoTokenOfflineException - if the crypto token for the CA wasn't found
        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.exception.CertificateSerialNumberException - if certificate with same subject DN or key already exists for a user, if these limitations are enabled in CA.
        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.CertificateRevokeException - (rollback) if certificate was meant to be issued revoked, but could not.
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.IllegalNameException - if the certificate request contained an illegal name
        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.CertificateCreateException - (rollback) if certificate couldn't be created.
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException - if the CA defined by caId doesn't exist.
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.InvalidAlgorithmException - fail

      • createCertificate

        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.request.ResponseMessage createCertificate​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken admin,
                                                                                org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.request.RequestMessage req,
                                                                                Class<? extends org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.request.CertificateResponseMessage> responseClass,
                                                                                org.cesecore.certificates.endentity.EndEntityInformation suppliedUserData)
                                                                         throws org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException,
                                                                                org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.certextensions.CertificateExtensionException,
                                                                                org.ejbca.core.ejb.ra.NoSuchEndEntityException,
                                                                                org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.exception.CustomCertificateSerialNumberException,
                                                                                org.cesecore.keys.token.CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                                                                                org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.IllegalKeyException,
                                                                                org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException,
                                                                                org.cesecore.certificates.ca.SignRequestException,
                                                                                org.cesecore.certificates.ca.SignRequestSignatureException,
                                                                                org.ejbca.core.model.ca.AuthStatusException,
                                                                                org.ejbca.core.model.ca.AuthLoginException,
                                                                                org.cesecore.certificates.ca.IllegalNameException,
                                                                                org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.CertificateCreateException,
                                                                                org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.CertificateRevokeException,
                                                                                org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.exception.CertificateSerialNumberException,
                                                                                org.cesecore.certificates.ca.IllegalValidityException,
                                                                                org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CAOfflineException,
                                                                                org.cesecore.certificates.ca.InvalidAlgorithmException
        Requests for a certificate to be created for the passed public key wrapped in a certification request message (ex PKCS10). The username and password used to authorize is taken from the request message. Verification of the signature (proof-of-possesion) on the request is performed, and an exception thrown if verification fails. The method queries the user database for authorization of the user.
        Parameters:
        admin - Information about the administrator or admin performing the event.
        req - a Certification Request message, containing the public key to be put in the created certificate. Currently no additional parameters in requests are considered!
        responseClass - The implementation class that will be used as the response message.
        suppliedUserData - Optional (can be null) supplied user data, if we are running without storing UserData this will be used. Should only be supplied when we issue certificates in a single transaction.
        Returns:
        The newly created response or null.
        Throws:
        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.certextensions.CertificateExtensionException - if there was an error with the extensions specified in the request message
        org.ejbca.core.ejb.ra.NoSuchEndEntityException - if the user does not exist.
        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.exception.CustomCertificateSerialNumberException - (no rollback) if custom serial number is registered for user, but it is not allowed to be used (either missing unique index in database, or certificate profile does not allow it
        org.cesecore.keys.token.CryptoTokenOfflineException - if the CA's crypto token was offline
        org.ejbca.core.model.ca.AuthStatusException - if the end entity's status is not on in which it may generate a certificate
        org.ejbca.core.model.ca.AuthLoginException - if the provided password is not the same as in the database
        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.IllegalKeyException - if the public key didn't conform to the constrains of the CA's certificate profile.
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException - if the targeted CA does not exist
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.SignRequestException - if the provided request doesn't contain a username or a password.
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.SignRequestSignatureException - if the request was not correctly signed
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.InvalidAlgorithmException - if the signing algorithm in the certificate profile (or the CA Token if not found) was invalid.
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CAOfflineException - if the CA was offline
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.IllegalValidityException - if the validity defined in the request was invalid
        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.exception.CertificateSerialNumberException - if certificate with same subject DN or key already exists for a user, if these limitations are enabled in CA.
        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.CertificateRevokeException - (rollback) if the certificate was meant to be issued revoked, but could not.
        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.CertificateCreateException - (rollback) if the certificate couldn't be created for any various reason
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.IllegalNameException - if the subject DN or SAN specified in the certificate request contains illegal characters
        org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException - if the authentication token wasn't authorized to the CA defined in the request

      • createCertificate

        Certificate createCertificate​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken admin,
                              String username,
                              String password,
                              org.cesecore.keys.util.PublicKeyWrapper pk,
                              int keyusage,
                              Date notBefore,
                              Date notAfter,
                              int certificateprofileid,
                              int caid)
                       throws org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException,
                              org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException,
                              org.ejbca.core.model.ca.AuthStatusException,
                              org.ejbca.core.model.ca.AuthLoginException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.IllegalKeyException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.CertificateCreateException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.ca.IllegalNameException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.CertificateRevokeException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.exception.CertificateSerialNumberException,
                              org.cesecore.keys.token.CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.ca.IllegalValidityException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CAOfflineException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.ca.InvalidAlgorithmException,
                              org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.exception.CustomCertificateSerialNumberException,
                              org.ejbca.core.ejb.ra.NoSuchEndEntityException
        Requests for a certificate to be created for the passed public key with the passed key usage and using the given certificate profile. This method is primarily intended to be used when issuing hardtokens having multiple certificates per user. The method queries the user database for authorization of the user. CAs are only allowed to have certificateSign and CRLSign set.
        Parameters:
        admin - Information about the administrator or admin performing the event.
        username - unique username within the instance.
        password - password for the user.
        pk - the public key to be put in the created certificate.
        keyusage - integer with bit mask describing desired keys usage, overrides keyUsage from CertificateProfiles if allowed. Bit mask is packed in in integer using constants from org.bouncycastle.jce.X509KeyUsage. -1 means use default keyUsage from CertificateProfile. ex. int keyusage = X509KeyUsage.digitalSignature | X509KeyUsage.nonRepudiation; gives digitalSignature and nonRepudiation. ex. int keyusage = X509KeyUsage.keyCertSign | X509KeyUsage.cRLSign; gives keyCertSign and cRLSign
        notBefore - an optional validity to set in the created certificate, if the profile allows validity override, null if the profiles default validity should be used.
        notAfter - an optional validity to set in the created certificate, if the profile allows validity override, null if the profiles default validity should be used.
        certificateprofileid - used to override the one set in userdata. Should be set to CertificateProfileConstants.CERTPROFILE_NO_PROFILE if the usedata certificateprofileid should be used
        caid - used to override the one set in userdata. Should be set to SecConst.CAID_USEUSERDEFINED if the regular certificateprofileid should be used
        Returns:
        The newly created certificate or null.
        Throws:
        org.ejbca.core.ejb.ra.NoSuchEndEntityException - if the user does not exist.
        org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException - (rollback) if admin is not authorized to issue this certificate
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException - if the CA defined by caId doesn't exist.
        org.ejbca.core.model.ca.AuthStatusException - If the users status is incorrect.
        org.ejbca.core.model.ca.AuthLoginException - If the password is incorrect.
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.InvalidAlgorithmException - if the signing algorithm in the certificate profile (or the CA Token if not found) was invalid.
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CAOfflineException - if the CA was offline
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.IllegalValidityException - if the validity defined by notBefore and notAfter was invalid
        org.cesecore.keys.token.CryptoTokenOfflineException - if the crypto token for the CA wasn't found
        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.exception.CertificateSerialNumberException - if certificate with same subject DN or key already exists for a user, if these limitations are enabled in CA.
        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.CertificateRevokeException - (rollback) if certificate was meant to be issued revoked, but could not.
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.IllegalNameException - if the certificate request contained an illegal name
        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.CertificateCreateException - (rollback) if certificate couldn't be created.
        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.IllegalKeyException - if the public key didn't conform to the constrains of the CA's certificate profile.
        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.exception.CustomCertificateSerialNumberException - (no rollback) if custom serial number is registered for user, but it is not allowed to be used (either missing unique index in database, or certificate profile does not allow it

      • createCardVerifiableCertificateWS

        Collection<org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.CertificateWrapper> createCardVerifiableCertificateWS​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                                                                                                       String username,
                                                                                                       String password,
                                                                                                       String cvcreq)
                                                                                                throws org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException,
                                                                                                       org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException,
                                                                                                       org.ejbca.core.model.ra.raadmin.UserDoesntFullfillEndEntityProfile,
                                                                                                       org.ejbca.core.model.ra.NotFoundException,
                                                                                                       org.ejbca.core.model.approval.ApprovalException,
                                                                                                       org.ejbca.core.EjbcaException,
                                                                                                       org.ejbca.core.model.approval.WaitingForApprovalException,
                                                                                                       org.cesecore.certificates.ca.SignRequestException,
                                                                                                       CertificateExpiredException,
                                                                                                       org.cesecore.CesecoreException
        Generates a CV certificate for a user.
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - the administrator performing the action.
        username - the user name of the user requesting the certificate.
        password - the password for initial enrollment, not used for renewal requests that can be authenticated using signatures with keys with valid certificates.
        cvcreq - Base64 encoded CVC request message.
        Returns:
        the full certificate chain for the IS, with IS certificate in pos 0, DV in 1, CVCA in 2.
        Throws:
        org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException - if administrator is not authorized to edit end entity or if an authenticated request can not be verified.
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException - if a referenced CA does not exist.
        org.ejbca.core.model.ra.raadmin.UserDoesntFullfillEndEntityProfile - if the request data does not full fill the end entity profile restrictions.
        org.ejbca.core.model.ra.NotFoundException - if the user could not be found.
        org.ejbca.core.model.approval.ApprovalException - if an approval was denied.
        org.ejbca.core.EjbcaException - any EjbcaException.
        org.ejbca.core.model.approval.WaitingForApprovalException - if there is a pending approval.
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.SignRequestException - if the provided request is invalid, for example not containing a username or password.
        CertificateExpiredException - if the users old certificate has expired.
        org.cesecore.CesecoreException - any CesecoreException.

      • createCertificateWS

        byte[] createCertificateWS​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                           String username,
                           String password,
                           String req,
                           int reqType,
                           String hardTokenSN,
                           String responseType)
                    throws org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException,
                           org.ejbca.core.EjbcaException,
                           org.cesecore.CesecoreException,
                           org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException,
                           org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.certextensions.CertificateExtensionException,
                           InvalidKeyException,
                           SignatureException,
                           InvalidKeySpecException,
                           NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                           NoSuchProviderException,
                           CertificateException,
                           IOException,
                           org.ejbca.cvc.exception.ParseException,
                           org.ejbca.cvc.exception.ConstructionException,
                           NoSuchFieldException,
                           org.ejbca.core.model.ca.AuthStatusException,
                           org.ejbca.core.model.ca.AuthLoginException
        Creates a certificate for the user with the given name.
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - the administrator performing the action.
        username - the users name.
        password - the users password
        req - the certificate request.
        reqType - the request type.
        hardTokenSN - the hard token SN, if available.
        responseType - the response type.
        Returns:
        DER-encoded certificate as byte array.
        Throws:
        org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException - if client isn't authorized to request.
        org.ejbca.core.EjbcaException - any EjbcaException.
        org.cesecore.CesecoreException - any CesecoreException.
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException - if the issuing CA associated with the user does not exist.
        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.certextensions.CertificateExtensionException - if a certificate extension could not be added to the certificate.
        InvalidKeyException - if the key is not valid.
        SignatureException - if a signature does not match (i.e. CSRs POP validation).
        InvalidKeySpecException - if the key specification is not available.
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the key algorithm is not available.
        NoSuchProviderException - if the required crypto provider is not installed.
        CertificateException - fail
        IOException - if the certificate could not be encoded.
        org.ejbca.cvc.exception.ParseException - if a CVC certificate could not be parsed.
        org.ejbca.cvc.exception.ConstructionException - if a CVC could not be assembled.
        NoSuchFieldException - is thrown if a CVC request can not be parsed.
        org.ejbca.core.model.ca.AuthStatusException - if the user has the wrong user status.
        org.ejbca.core.model.ca.AuthLoginException - if the users password does not match.

      • createRequestFailedResponse

        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.request.ResponseMessage createRequestFailedResponse​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken admin,
                                                                                          org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.request.RequestMessage req,
                                                                                          Class<? extends org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.request.ResponseMessage> responseClass,
                                                                                          org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.request.FailInfo failInfo,
                                                                                          String failText)
                                                                                   throws org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException,
                                                                                          org.cesecore.keys.token.CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                                                                                          org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException
        Method that generates a request failed response message. The request should already have been decrypted and verified.
        Parameters:
        admin - Information about the administrator or admin performing the event.
        req - a Certification Request message, containing the public key to be put in the created certificate. Currently no additional parameters in requests are considered!
        responseClass - The implementation class that will be used as the response message.
        failInfo - the failure info in the failure response, for example FailInfo.BAD_REQUEST
        failText - free text failure message
        Returns:
        A decrypted and verified ResponseMessage message
        Throws:
        org.cesecore.keys.token.CryptoTokenOfflineException - if the cryptotoken use by the CA defined in the request is unavailable
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException - if the targeted CA does not exist
        org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException - if the authentication token wasn't authorized to the CA defined in the request

      • decryptAndVerifyRequest

        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.request.RequestMessage decryptAndVerifyRequest​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken admin,
                                                                                     org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.request.RequestMessage req)
                                                                              throws org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException,
                                                                                     org.cesecore.certificates.ca.SignRequestSignatureException,
                                                                                     org.cesecore.keys.token.CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                                                                                     org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException
        Method that just decrypts and verifies a request and should be used in those cases a when encrypted information needs to be extracted and presented to an RA for approval.
        Parameters:
        admin - Information about the administrator or admin performing the event.
        req - a Certification Request message, containing the public key to be put in the created certificate. Currently no additional parameters in requests are considered!
        Returns:
        A decrypted and verified RequestMessage message
        Throws:
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException - if the targeted CA does not exist
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.SignRequestSignatureException - if the the request couldn't be verified.
        org.cesecore.keys.token.CryptoTokenOfflineException - fail
        org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        See Also:
        RequestMessage, ResponseMessage, X509ResponseMessage

      • getCRL

        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.request.ResponseMessage getCRL​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken admin,
                                                                     org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.request.RequestMessage req,
                                                                     Class<? extends org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.request.ResponseMessage> responseClass)
                                                              throws org.ejbca.core.model.ca.AuthStatusException,
                                                                     org.ejbca.core.model.ca.AuthLoginException,
                                                                     org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.IllegalKeyException,
                                                                     org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException,
                                                                     org.cesecore.certificates.ca.SignRequestException,
                                                                     org.cesecore.certificates.ca.SignRequestSignatureException,
                                                                     UnsupportedEncodingException,
                                                                     org.cesecore.keys.token.CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                                                                     org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException
        Parameters:
        admin - Information about the administrator or admin performing the event.
        req - a CRL Request message
        responseClass - the implementation class of the desired response
        Returns:
        The newly created certificate or null.
        Throws:
        org.ejbca.core.model.ca.AuthStatusException - fail
        org.ejbca.core.model.ca.AuthLoginException - fail
        org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.IllegalKeyException - if the public key is of wrong type.
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException - if the targeted CA does not exist
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.SignRequestException - if the provided request is invalid.
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.SignRequestSignatureException - if the provided client certificate was not signed by the CA.
        UnsupportedEncodingException - fail
        org.cesecore.keys.token.CryptoTokenOfflineException - fail
        org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException - fail

      • fetchCertGenParams

        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CertificateGenerationParams fetchCertGenParams()
        Returns an object with configuration parameters for extensions (currently only for the CT extension). This information is needed by CESeCore methods that create certificates, since it must be fetched from the EJBCA configuration. Currently, this is needed in CertificateCreateSession and X509CA. The return value should only be passed directly into one of the CeSECore methods that use it. There's no point in accessing it from EJBCA code.
        Returns:
        params
